Manager Response: Thank you valued guest for recommending our hotel to other travellers! Thank you for your feedback on our comfortable accommodations, excellent customer service and convenient location.We appreciate your time in completing the review and look forward to see you again.  Sinverely, Pat

Summary: This place was not the holiday inn in any way, however it was great for the price and the location was excellent. The rooms were very clean and they offered an continental breaffast.The staff was very friendly.   Not a very long walk to Disneyland (which was the reason for our visit ) or the shuttle stops right out in front. The shuttle is 4.00 for adults for all day.
Manager Response: Thank you valued guest  for the review! We are glad you found your stay with us affordable and enjoyable. We are very close to Disneyland, just a 10 to 15 minute walk. The ART shuttle picks up right at front door as well (we are one of the hotel participate with ART Shuttle). We so appreciate knowing that you were satisfied with your stay. We take pride in our customer service and strive to provide clean and comfortable rooms at a good price. we look forward to your next visit with us  Sincerely, Pat

Summary Heading: great place to stay and frienldy people a+++++++++++++++++++++++
Summary: my  name is BART AND MY WIFE IS TINA  we stayed at this hotel for four weeks and it has been fantastic it was clean and the staff were so friendly they help us out in every thing that we asked for if it was for tickets of just extra towels or just a chat the pool was great and the spar was hot it was a great place to stay and the prices was great it is so close to evertyhing that you need we are coming back next year and will be staying there for another four weeks we are so looking forward to coming back thankyou againg to the remarkable  stay a++++++++++++++++++++++++++++=
Manager Response: Dear Bart & Tina, Thank you for staying with us & your time to give review on our hotel.Thank you for the many compliments on our accommodations and amazing customer service. It is always our pleasure to assist you in any way we can throughout your entire stay. We appreciate your excellent review and look forward to seeing you again next year.

Summary: My husband and I had the main goal of spending all of our time at Disneyland. If you need a place to stay with an amazing value we highly recommend this location. The service was wonderful too! We were in D-land to celebrate our five year anniversary. The owner  went out of his way to make it special. We arrived with flowers and champagne in our room. Great Value, Service and Location!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: For four years in a row i've stayed at this hotel. In october every year I travel from Sweden to California to visit carshows and swapmeets. This hotel is the best, the staff is really friendly and likes a good joke. It has walkingdistance to good restaurants and to Disneyland as well for those who like that. The rooms are clean and the service is great. I'm sure i'll be here next year as well.
Manager Response: Thank you valued guest for your positive comments for travellers to read.  We so appreciate knowing that you were satisfied with your stay and that you make a trip each year.  We look forward to your return and won't let you down! Sincerely, Pat

Summary: Excellent location. Within walking distance to Disneyland. Close to Garden Walk and probably the best restuarant around The Cheesecake Factory. Near to all public transport and services. Have stayed here a couple of times and never had a problem. Staff always friendly and always helpful. If you want something affordable and close to Disneyland would highly recommend this place.
Manager Response: Thank you valued guest for recommending our hotel to other travellers!  We take pride in our customer service and strive to provide clean and comfortable rooms at a good price.  We look forward to your next trip to Anaheim. Sinverely, Pat

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Good location - within walking distance of Disneyland, dining, and shopping.  Parking was free and not a problem.  The bed was not comfortable and the pillows were like as thick and comfortable as folded towels.  There is not do not disturb sign and the cleaners enter your room whether you want them to or not.  They also watch some TV while they're in your room as well as go through your fridge items.  We left on a light and the AC as we would not be returning until dark but they turned them both off against our wishes and left the curtains open.  The tub and the toilet were both dirty when we arrived and were still dirty when we left despite the cleaning lady entering our room each day.  Apparently they only make beds and change towels.    The room had a coffee maker but you'll
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that you were dissatisfied with your stay.  Please accect my apology for your inconvienences and we thank you for bringing these items to our attention for immediate correction.  Sincerely, Pat

Summary Heading: fun jazzy little place, close to EVERYTHING
Summary: This was one of my favorite places.Staff extremely HAPPY, FRIENDLY, and everything was within walking distance. Room extremely clean!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great Location for the Disneyland parks 15 min walk, with food and shopping only a block away.  The staff made every effort to help me with any request and the price was great!  Would definately reccomend to anyone travelling on a budget.
Manager Response: Dear Natabrata,   Thank you for your feedback on our comfortable accommodations, excellent customer service and convenient location.   We appreciate your time in completing the review and look forward to see you again. Pat Manager

Summary Heading: No frills, cheap hotel, right up the street from Disneyland
Summary: If you need a room that provides the basic necessities and require no frills, and want it to be within walking distance from from Disneyland, this is the place. The pool area looks nice with the fountains and plants and this place is about a 10 minute walk from Disneyland.  The guy who was at the Front Desk seemed friendly enough.  In regards to cleanliness, the place is just average.  I could see how some reviewers might say that the complimentary breakfast is a "joke" (all they put out is donuts and danishes w/ coffee or watered down OJ) however what do you expect for price.  If you wanted a good complimentary breakfast, you should have stayed at a Holiday Inn Express.  In the room you do get a small microwave and fridge. The free Wi-Fi was non-existent since we stayed in a
Manager Response: Dear Johnpeso,  Thank you for your review on our hotel. We apologize that we did not meet your needs on your recent stay with us. Your comments and suggestions have been reviewed and taken seriously. We appreciate your time in giving us your feedback.  Pat  Manager

Summary Heading: very friendly, sound accomodation, geat location for disney
Summary: the staff were very accomodating, I had major problems leaving uk, so had to change my hotel accomodation dates twice, nothing was a problem, even though i had booked seven days I may have had to cut my stay short and they were quite willing to give me a refund, the staff made the place really, extremely helpful with information directions etc.. the room was large enough, could hear next doors tv through walls,didn't like the set out for the windows, had to keep curtains drawn as anyone on balcony could look in, but then we were at disney from 8am till midnight nearly every day so hardly ever there, nice swimming pool 7/11 very close and garden city shopping next door!! so for a stranger not knowing the area and there for disney (10 minute walk, and I'm not a fast walker) was a
Manager Response: Thank you valued guest for staying with us.We take pride in our customer service .We look forward to your next trip to Anaheim. Sinverely, Pat

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights with our 3 year old son.  Had a 2 bedroom room which was generous in size.  Our room had a fridge which came in very handy.  Disneyland was only a 10-15 minute walk to the gates. No onsite laundry, but had onsite parking. Breakfast was donuts and coffee, didnt eat it as there are so many other options available.  We had a pram and were staying on the second (and top) floor, and as there is no lift we had to carry the pram up and down the stairs everytime we left the hotel.  This didn't bother us but it is something that may be an issue to some. Also the heater/air conditioner worked well but was very noisy..again it didn't bother us but may be annoying for others. Overall, this is our second stay in Anaheim.  Our first stay was in a place that cost more
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was absolutely amazing value for money –the price was so low I expected it to be a bit skanky but  the room was  much more spacious than I had anticipated and quite clean and comfortable. There was an intimate, cosy feel to the establishment  and staff were very welcoming and helpful. Fantastic to have a swim in a pool after a long flight from Australia. Shops and places to eat were all a short walk away and I felt quite safe walking around by myself at night.  Disneyland was about a 5-10 minute walk away. Highly recommended.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Never ever again! And the "continental breakfast" what a joke!
Summary: I booked this hotel for my family vacation thinking that it was one that we had stayed in before. Well it wasn't! When we VERY quickly learned that it wasn't the lady at the front was rude when we wanted to change the length of our stay, fair enough she got upset but your in the Tourism industry and things can change! The family rooms were large enough and travelling with a budget in mind, they were just bareable. But they did look tired looking and things are in need of a freshen up. The top bedding looked like it had never been washed in such a long time! Pool was good, and outside the property is kept well.  The location was handy real close to the convention centre, car hire, disneyland is a bit of a walk. I would consider as you have a larger fridge int the room go to a
Manager Response: none

Summary: We tried various motels around Anaheim as we were staying for 3 weeks. This one proved to be the most affordable and cleanest.  Facilities were a bit outdated but the rooms were spacious.  Also had fridge and microvawe in the room.   Less than 10 min walking distance to Disneyland.  Fancy restaurants to the left and more affordable takeaway places to the right.  (Must try the best pizza around the corner - think it's called California Pizza Place).  All within a few minutes walking distance.  Avis was just across the road, as were other major hire car companies (but we found Avis to be the best in price).  Loved the pool.  It was always clean.  Basic b'fast was provided each morning.  The manager on duty at the time was very helpful.  Organised transport transfers from the hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had an excellent stay at this hotel...  Pros - Great room layout if travelling as a family or group...  Separate bedroom for privacy. - Big room, plenty of room with a fridge and microwave included - Very nice pool, jacuzzi and grounds - Exceptional value for money, suite was cheaper than twin queen rooms we have stayed at closer to DL on Harbor - Location is only 10 minute walk to Resort entrance on Harbor, only 5 to 8 minutes further than the closest Hotels and about the same distance that Disneyland Hotel is from entrance... - Plenty of Parking and free - Quiet, only a couple of rooms front Katella, I would avoid those as the rest were very quiet... - Smaller Hotel (40 rooms) no crowded pools etc - Free Wifi in room  Neutral - Cleaning, came at odd times and a little
Manager Response: none

Summary: We found our family suite spacious, clean and very reasonably priced, including all the obvious essentials (with a fridge and free wi-fi). It was great to have a separate room for the grown up(s) to sleep in. We found the staff very friendly, practical and helpful, and we enjoyed the pool. Obviously you get what you pay for, but if you can put up with the odd loose fitting and a few scuffs on the carpet, then this is a good budget family option in a safe area, well-placed for Disneyland and other local attractions.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Recently stayed here with friends from overseas in 3 rooms.  I'd stay here previously several years ago and I did love both price and location.  It didn't disappoint, rooms were great, bathroom was clean and service was awesome.  We did spend lots of time poolside with our teens and youngers kids, and that was such a plus to have such a big pool.  Great restaurants nearby. Thanks.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Would not stay again - misleading pictures on website
Summary: This place looked pretty decent from reveiws and pictures i read/saw. We arrived at 10pm and it felt like we were gonna get mugged parking behind the hotel. The outside was pretty nice looking, nice courtyard/pool area. The room however was completely the opposite. The room was hot as hell when we walked  in and smelled of "funk" The bathroom was the worst part of it. The corners were filled with dirt/dust/crud, the tub was FILTHY (possibly stained with dirt), the toilet seat was crooked/loose, the vent fan was hanging down from the roof, The bed had 2 flat pillows on it which did nothing for comfortable sleeping. The microwave and fridge were turning yellow from old age / being dirty all the time.  The hightlight of the room was that it was quiet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Now, i would like to say that in general i have been satisfied with this chain, but this stay was by far a nightmare and when i tried to tell the manager in a calm fashion what the problem was she wasnt very helpful so i was like "forget about it.".. Also there were children by me and i didnt want to traumatize them by going into detail... Basically the "guest room" in our room where i stayed had "very used" sheets they were dirty, smelly, had pubic hairs aaaaallll over and long blonde hairs in them as well. there was an empty box of condoms on the opposite side (from when u walk in) of the bed . So since it was hot, i stripped down the bed and slept with a towl for a pillow. It was almost 3 AM and i just wanted to fall asleep at  that point....also i didnt want to leave the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay on a tight budget
Summary: I really liked this hotel. Don't go there expecting a luxury hotel room though. This room had the necessities and that's about it.   Pros: Comfortable bed Good size fridge, microwave and a coffee maker Very close to Disneyland. It was about a 10 min. walk. Close to restaurants & the Garden Walk.  Very friendly staff  Cons: Housekeeping schedule is weird. They clean from 9-6 p.m. It was disappointing to know that we walked into a dirty hotel room at 5:00 p.m.   If you're taking the shuttle BACK to the hotel, it's the last stop. You're better off walking esp. if you take the last shuttle at 12:30 a.m. On the other hand, if you're taking it TO Disneyland, you'll be there at the very next stop.   Like i said, there's nothing breathtaking about this hotel but as you can see... the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were there with my 17year old son and 2 of his friends. We all loved the fact that noone had to share beds and that the teens were in their own room next door.  I have to disagree with the "made my skin crawl" review. The hotel could use some tlc, but it was clean. My feet did NOT turn black from the carpet like at other value hotels. The noise level was very minimal. My husband and I did not hear the 3 boys at all and they were in an adjoining room. My son even commented that he slept like a baby which is quite a compliment. The only negative of our trip was that the wifii never worked efficiently. My husband was able to log on, but would then lose signal whenever he tired to get onto any sites. Would we go back? If we were traveling with people on a tight budget probably,

Summary: Stayed here for a few nights on arrival in to the US. It is within walking distance to the Graden Walk, and Disneyland, as well as plenty of food outlets.  The rooms were clean and tidy.  Our 'family suite' had plenty of space, and was more than adequate.  The only tiny issue we had was the wireless internet wasn't that usable early on, but they fixed that just before we left.  The pool was nice, and seemed to be cleaned daily.  Overall our stay was very pleasant.  I would have no problems staying there again.

Summary: We only stayed one night because we decided to come to Anaheim a day earlier than expected.  This was a fine hotel, nothing fancy, but it did the job.  Our room was quite small, and the bathroom was set up differently than I'm accustomed to at a motel, and a little harder to work with.  Breakfast is provided, but it's just a few pastries and juice on the counter of the check-in area.  I really appreciated the accommodation by the staff, letting us leave our car for a few hours after checkout so we could hang out at Disneyland a bit longer before moving to our other hotel.

Summary: We stayed at this Hotel last week and had a perfectly pleasant stay. We stayed in one of the mini suites. Its a regular hotel room with a separate room with a queen bed. I was staying wih my partner and a friend so it was great to have the privacy.  The hotel is about a 10 minute walk (without kids) at maximum from the gate of Disneyland. There is no need to worry about safety walking home we walked home a midnight and there are plenty of people on the streets.   The hotel it build around a courtyard with a pool and hot tub. The noise carries and it is qite loud outside from around 7am onwards. But thats not really a problem as we werent in our hotel except to sleep after a exausting day. Summary Heading: Booked under a different name? Difficult to find!

Summary: We came to this hotel after staying in a horrible place and it was amazing. Firstly the staff were very friendly and accomodating, any problems we had they were more than happy to help us with. It was so good we stayed there twice, the first time we were given a room with four double beds and it was definately value for money. The hotel is very close the new garden walk shopping complex which meant that when it came to dinners we were spoiled for choice (our favourite was the cheesecake factory). Of all the hotels we stayed at on our 5 week trip this has to be one of the best and excellent value for money. Definately would go back there.

Summary: We went there for mini vacation.  We loved the atrium style courtyard.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were large and comfortable.  Would stay there every time we travel to anaheim.  Loved this hotel

Summary: I recently stayed at America's Best Value Inn and Suites Anaheim(formerly known as the Anaheim Fantasy Inn And Suites) from April 18-21, 2006. This Hotel is family owned, and I found the staff, including the maids, to be very friendly. The room was very well cleaned and very spacious, larger than most rooms. The Hotel was also nice and quiet, with a very lovely pool. I enjoyed the microwave and refrigerator, which often came in handy. The Continental Breakfast was average, but I never ate it in the mornings, we walked to Denny's instead. There are other restaurants and convenience stores within walking distance, as well as Disneyland. This Hotel is exactly what me and my boyfriend needed to relax. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Disneyland. Loved It!!!!!!

Summary Heading: Don't Be Fooled By The "Fantasy" Name!
Summary: I stayed at Fantasy Inn with my family and relatives to visit Disneyland's 50th Anniversary. We picked it due to it's cheap price, but soon learned that you actually do get what you pay for! Summary: After lengthy research into which hotel/motel to stay at during my family's first visit to Disneyland, I decided on booking the Anaheim Fantasy Inn & Suites.  This decision was based on the rate package, hotel amenities, the proximity to Disneyland and the favourable reviews by previous guests.  On the plus side, the rooms are of generous size, and the warm pool was a hit with the kids.  It was great having a fridge and microwave.  On the downside, the bathroom was quite dirty, the tub was chipped and the maid service was lacking as I had to request bath towels on our 2nd day. The danishes that come with breakfast were tasty as long as they were fresh, which wasn't the case on a daily basis. A choice of muffins would be a bonus. Summary Heading: Exactly what we were looking for!
Summary: The Anaheim Fantasy Inn and Suites was exactly what we were hoping for.  It was within 2 blocks of Disneyland - definitely a little exercise, but not too far.  It was clean and very spacious.  We got a family suite (4 double beds) for $89 a night within walking distance of the Disneyland.  We couldn't ask for better than that and it seemed well run.  Never did we have to ask twice for anything, the management was very accomodating.  We could see the fireworks from our hotel window which was great because we wanted to avoid the crowds.  If you're looking for a nice, clean, roomy, place to stay that is close to Disneyland, this was the place.  No big bells and whistles, but what do you expect for $89/night?  I would definitely recommend it and would come back.

Summary Heading: Great Price, Clean and Close to Disneyland
Summary: We reserved two connecting rooms and got a great price on both rooms.  I was a little leary of staying there because the price was so low, but I was pleasantly surprised.  It's a motel-type property that reminded me of vacations with my parents years ago, but was very clean and had lots of hot water in the shower!  We had a king bed in our room w/a double bed in an adjoining room---the connecting room had the same set-up so it was great, since we were four adults and two children.  Each child had their own bed and room off the main room.  Coffee, juice and pastries were available in the office in the morning...nothing fancy, but enough to tide us over until we could have a regular breakfast.  Best of all, we were able to walk to Disneyland----no parking hassles.  Very convenient

Plus there is a Subway just around the corner to pick up lunch before going to the park. Kids enjoyed the compact pool and it seemed cleaner than some others I experienced at pricier hotels. Very well positioned for DLand. Guy on desk at night v friendly & helpful, daytime guy much less so. It is a cheap and basic hotel but I think it is good value.

Summary Heading: Great Value for a clean room
